intro: Ribes mandshuricum var. villosum, commonly known as the hairy gooseberry, is a variant of the gooseberry plant native to eastern Asia. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellow berries that are typically harvested in late summer. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland or shrubland habitats. Botanically, it belongs to the Grossulariaceae family and is closely related to other species of the Ribes genus.
